brand.name: syne autonomous
credibilityCues: Designed for crews and inspectors in the field.
Start with Calgary + Alberta; expand nationally.

tone.inspectors: Premium, authoritative, precise, collaborative. Emphasize verifiable/defensible/traceable.

headlineOptions: Turn jobsite chaos into a clean system of record.
Capture every extra. Prove every inspection. Close out faster.
Jobsite intelligence + building code compliance—end to end.
hero.subheadline: Syne autonomous turns photos, WhatsApp updates, and field notes into structured project data, automated workflows, and jurisdiction-aware building code verification—from design through closeout.

audiences.title: For contractors and trades
bullets: Snap a photo of paper → AI extracts structured fields (daily logs, inspection reports, change orders, safety forms).
Forward WhatsApp photos or send voice notes → structured updates (progress, materials, delays, extras).
Auto-updates timelines, daily logs, and next invoice triggers.
Produces audit-ready compliance records with a searchable documentation trail.

audiences.title: For inspectors and municipalities
bullets: Jurisdiction-aware building code engine (national, provincial, municipal) converted into verifiable checkpoints.
Continuous evidence verification across design documents, construction photos, test reports, and inspection records.
Defensible approval packages with traceable rule-to-evidence mapping.
Reduces review cycles without replacing human judgment.

codeComplianceEngine.name: Evidence Verification
codeComplianceEngine.desc: Design docs, shop drawings, photos, test reports, certifications.

codeComplianceEngine.name: Inspector Portal
codeComplianceEngine.desc: Review queue, field tools, sign-off workflows.

complianceCenter.name: Permit & Inspection Tracker
complianceCenter.desc: Status, due dates, reminders, required docs.

complianceCenter.name: Safety Documentation
complianceCenter.desc: Toolbox talks, incident logs, orientation records.

complianceCenter.name: QA/QC Checklists
complianceCenter.desc: Trade sign-offs, photo evidence, timestamped logs.

complianceCenter.name: Audit Trail
complianceCenter.desc: Who/when/what; searchable history with code references.

complianceCenter.name: Compliance Reporting
complianceCenter.desc: Exportable packages for owners, auditors, regulators.

integrations.name: WhatsApp (Twilio)
integrations.desc: Forward photos + voice notes into the inbox.

buildingCodeCompliancePage.definition: Building code compliance is the systematic process of ensuring that buildings, renovations, and infrastructure meet legal, safety, accessibility, environmental, and performance requirements defined by national, provincial/state, and municipal authorities.
buildingCodeCompliancePage.whatWeDo: We convert building codes into jurisdiction-aware, machine-readable rules, continuously verify evidence across design, construction, and inspection phases, and produce defensible, audit-ready approvals without replacing human judgment.
offerings: Jurisdiction mapping and code library setup (Alberta Building Code, National Building Code, Calgary bylaws, etc.)
Rule conversion (code sections → structured verification checkpoints)
Evidence collection and linking (design documents, test reports, photos, certifications)
Continuous compliance verification (real-time status per code requirement)
Inspector collaboration tools (field verification, annotations, sign-offs)
Non-compliance workflow (flag, document, assign, verify correction)

faq.q: Do you support WhatsApp for contractors?
faq.a: Yes—photos and voice notes can be forwarded into the inbox for structured extraction and logging.
Syne provides rule-to-evidence checkpoints and traceability; final judgment remains with qualified humans.
Offline use is on the roadmap.

faq.q: Who owns the data and how is audit trail integrity handled?
faq.a: You own your data; the system maintains a tamper-evident activity trail (who/when/what) and preserves attachments.
Start with Alberta/Calgary; roadmap expands to other provinces.

faq.q: How long does code library mapping setup take?
faq.a: Depends on jurisdiction scope and workflows; typical onboarding is days to a couple weeks.
Role-based training plus a guided pilot using real permit sets and a standardized approval package output.
